intro: Callista scabrilinguis, commonly known as the rough-leaved callista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Callista scabrilinguis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
